name: Bluerot
transmission: Contracted through wounds inflicted by undead carrying the disease, or contact with corpses infected with bluerot.
symptoms: The infected creature's skin takes on a blue-gray pallor, starting at the wound site and spreading outward. The creature develops a foul odor and their personality becomes dull and apathetic.

effects.description: The infected creature has disadvantage on Charisma checks and vulnerability to radiant damage. Additionally, the creature's skin turns visibly blue-gray, making it difficult to hide the disease.

recovery: At the end of each long rest, an infected creature can make a DC 12 Constitution saving throw. On a successful save, the disease is cured. A creature that fails three of these saving throws gains a randomly determined form of indefinite madness (as described in the DMG madness tables).
cure: A Lesser Restoration spell or similar magic cures the disease immediately.
